Ed Kelce added that he’d personally known Travis Kelce would ask Swift to marry him ever since his last NFL season.
“That’s when it became obvious they were just crazy about each other,” he said.

title: Craig Melvin Revisits His Hilarious Proposal Story in the Wake of Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce Engagement
summary: Craig Melvin shared his proposal story to Lindsay Czarniak in the aftermath of Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce.
story: After Taylor Swift shared photos from her swoonworthy garden proposal, TODAY’s Craig Melvin looked back at his own big moment leading up to “I do.”

Speaking with Holly Palmieri, anchor of the TODAY Show Radio on SiriusXM, Craig recalled the day he proposed to Lindsay Czarniak, his wife of nearly 14 years, sharing that it wasn't quite an immediate, "yes."
When asked if he got down on one knee in a garden like Swift’s newly minted fiancé, Travis Kelce, Craig chuckled.
“Not a garden,” Craig shared. “I did it on a boat down in Miami.”

The co-anchor shared that the location wasn’t random. Miami was a place special to Czarniak: It was where she had worked and lived for some time before they married. Still, while Craig went all in, his plans didn’t exactly go off without a hitch.
“It was a surprise, and it almost didn’t go well,” he said. “I was all fumbly, and the boat was late.”
Finally, when he got the chance to propose, Craig shared that Czarniak’s first reaction wasn’t exactly the one he’d expected.

“The first thing she said to me after I asked her, I had prepared this thing in my head, I kid you not — she's going to hate me for telling this story ... she said, 'I think I'm going to throw up,'" Craig recalled.

“And in the moment, I was like, maybe I misread this. Maybe I overplayed my hand. It seems like it’s been going well for a couple of years. And then she’s like, “No, no, no ... yes. I just, I’m just, ‘I think I’m gonna be sick.’”

TODAY's Laura Jarrett chimed in that Czarniak was probably just "overwhelmed." She also assured Craig that his now wife's unexpected response — paired with her eventual "yes" — actually made his story all the sweeter.

“I think it’s nice to still be surprised. I think there are so few surprises anymore,” Laura explained. “Everything is overly scripted and overly done, and it’s just nice when it’s like, you didn’t get to see the ring, you didn’t know where it was gonna be, and it's just the two of you.”
“Thanks for making me feel better,” Craig replied.
Craig and Czarniak have been married since 2011. Together, they share two children: a son named Delano, born in March 2014, and a daughter, Sybil, born in November 2016.

title: Donna Kelce Celebrates Travis and Taylor's Engagement with Childhood Pics of Both
summary: Donna Kelce changed her Facebook cover photo to a pair of pictures of son Travis and Taylor Swift as kids to celebrate their engagement news.
story: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are getting married, and it seems as if his mother couldn’t be happier these crazy kids are tying the knot.
On Aug. 27, Donna Kelce changed her Facebook cover photo to feature pictures of her Kansas City Chiefs star son and Swift as children.
The updated cover photo prompted fans to chime in in the comments with their congratulations about the impending nuptials.
Travis Kelce and Swift announced their engagement in a joint Instagram post on Aug. 26.
“Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married,” they captioned a quintet of photos, adding an emoji of a stick of dynamite.

Donna Kelce has certainly made an impression on the “Blank Space” singer. Swift called her and Patrick Mahomes’ wife, Brittany Mahomes, her “two pillars of support” in the six-part ESPN documentary “The Kingdom: Kansas City Chiefs.”
Donna Kelce also had high praise for Swift after the release of the music superstar's last album, 2024’s “The Tortured Poets Department.”
“I was just very impressed,” she told People. “She is a very talented woman and I think it is probably her best work.”
Donna Kelce was also asked if she has any advice for Swift about aging, prompting her to say she “doesn’t need my advice on anything.”
“In fact, I hope she will give me advice,” she added.
Donna Kelce, who has been spotted with Swift at Chiefs games, has also said the Grammy winner had a positive effect on her son.
“I can tell you this,” she told WSJ. Magazine in 2023. “He’s happier than I’ve seen him in a long time ... God bless him, he shot for the stars!”

Travis Kelce’s dad and Donna Kelce’s ex-husband, Ed Kelce, also seems pleased about the relationship. He said his son and Swift actually got engaged at a garden in Lee’s Summit, Missouri, about two weeks before they announced the news.

“He got her out there, they were about to go out to dinner, and he said, ‘Let’s go out and have a glass of wine’ ... they got out there, and that’s when he asked her, and it was beautiful,” he told ABC affiliate WEWS in Cleveland.
“They started FaceTiming me and their mother and her folks to make sure everybody knew. So, to see them together is great.”

title: The 1 Item Meghan Markle Said She Always Had to Wear as a Royal
summary: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex is happy not to follow this royal fashion rule which she said was "inauthentic."
story: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, has no trouble recalling one stuffy fashion custom she doesn't miss from her time as a working member of the British royal family.

“I had to wear nude pantyhose all the time. Let’s be honest, that was not very myself. I hadn’t seen pantyhose since movies in the ‘80s when they came in the little egg," the former Meghan Markle said, laughing, during a candid interview with  journalist Emily Chang published Aug. 26 on Bloomberg's "The Circuit."

Markle mentioned the pantyhose while noting that prior to her and husband Prince Harry's decision to step back from their roles in the royal family in 2020, it was a challenge for her to fully be herself in public.
“That felt a little inauthentic. It’s a silly example,” she said of the pantyhose.

“But it is an example of being able to dress the way you want to dress and say the things that are true and you’re able to show up in a space really organically and authentically, that’s being comfortable in your own skin and that’s had different chapters in my life," she added.
The interview arrived the same day of the Season 2 premiere of Markle's Netflix lifestyle series, "With Love, Meghan."
Netflix released a trailer for the new season on Aug. 12. The trailer showed Markle back in her kitchen and garden where she'll continue hosting celebrity chefs, lifestyle experts and famous friends.
The series, which premiered on March 4, 2025, focuses on Markle sharing tips about cooking, hosting, crafting, decorating and more.

Chrissy Teigen, Christina Tosi, Clare Smyth, Daniel Martin, David Chang, Heather Dorak, Jay Shetty, Jose Andres, Radhi Devlukia, Samin Nosrat and Tan France are all slated to make appearances in Season 2.

title: Food Brands Are Offering Freebies and Deals in Honor of Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s Engagement
summary: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's engagement inspired food brands like DoorDash, Portillo's, Papa Johns and California Pizza Kitchen to offer freebees and deals.
story: It was the engagement heard ‘round the world — and food brands are hopping on the betrothal bandwagon by discounting their wares.
On Aug. 26, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce announced they are engaged to be married, and Swifties around the globe have fully leaned in to the joy of the moment.

Among those Swifties are chain restaurants, which have taken the opportunity to weigh in: Starbucks admitted its PSL drop was overshadowed; Panera and Auntie Anne’s punnily posted; and Buffalo Wild Wings offered to cater the wedding.
There are also some food brands who took the happy news to offer tasty discounts and freebies — like Krispy Kreme, who offered free doughnut rings for two hours on Aug. 26.
Here are all the food deals and specials being offered in honor of Swift and Kelce’s “Love Story”:
California Pizza Kitchen

Starting Aug. 29, California Pizza Kitchen is offering customers heart-shaped pizzas to celebrate T & T’s upcoming nuptials. For 13 days — Swift’s lucky number — CPK guests can order an “It’s a Love Story Pizza,” featuring a heart-shaped thin crust pizza in any flavor (starting at $17.99), available for a limited time for dine-in and takeout.
Papa Johns
If you share a name with the bride- or groom-to-be, you win.

On Aug. 27 only, Papa Johns is giving $13 worth of free Papa Dough — which can be used to get a free pizza — to every Papa Rewards member named Taylor or Travis. The bonus is available nationwide in-store, online and on the Papa Johns app, and it must be used by 12 a.m. EST.
Olipop
Olipop announced on Instagram that customers can take an extra 13% off any new or existing subscription order by using code LOVERS13.
This is on top of its 15% subscription discount, which means redeemers will get 28% off any one subscription order “from now until forever.”
DoorDash
Starting Aug. 27, DoorDash is offering Swifties 13% off their DoorDash order with the code THIRTEEN, for a limited time.
Portillo’s
Portillo’s perks members can score a free small Onion Rings with a purse of $1.13 or more. The offer is only valid for seven days and is limited to one redemption per customer.
Sonny’s BBQ

In honor of Swift and Kelce’s Instagram caption (“Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married”), Sonny’s BBQ is offering a BOGO BBQ Sandwich deal of Pork, Pulled Chicken or Turkey Sandwiches to all teachers dining in on Aug. 27 and 28. They just need to show a valid faculty ID to redeem it.

title: 'Love Is Blind: UK' Season 2 Finale: Who Got Married?
summary: Who gets married in the Love Is Blind UK season 2 finale? Find out what happens to all the couples.
story: And just like that, another season of "Love Is Blind: UK" is officially in the books.
The Netflix reality dating series returned for its sophomore season earlier this month and introduced viewers to a whole new cast of singles looking for love.
The series followed a total of five couples that got engaged and gave an update on who got married in the finale, which debuted on Aug. 27.
Was love truly blind for all of the couples? Find out below.
Bardha and Jed
Relationship status: Not married

What happened in the show? After speaking with Jed for the first time in the pods, Bardha said, "I just met my husband." Their chemistry grew quickly and they connected on their shared desire to have children. Soon, Jed started calling her "my Bardha."

While living together, the couple navigated a few cultural differences, namely Jed's desire to be the one who paid for his wife and took care of her financially. Meanwhile, Bardha admitted that she's used to being "strong and independent."

Before separating on the eve of their wedding, Bardha told Jed, "I don't want to be married twice. I'm not doing this again." On their wedding day, Bardha opened up in a confessional interview and admitted that she and Jed had been having a few arguments recently.

While speaking with his friends on the day of his wedding, Jed said he was confident that Bardha would say "I do," despite their differences in communication style. Jed then told his friends he was ready for marriage.
At the altar, Bardha said she wants to fully commit to Jed one day, just not now. Outside of the wedding venue, Bardha told Jed he had "all of my heart" and he corrected her, saying, "99% of it."
Jed asked Bardha why she decided to say "I don't" and she cited all the arguments they recently had, saying they'd left her "in a weird state of mind."

When members of Jed's family asked him what he planned to say at the altar, he seemed to be undecided. In a confessional interview, Bardha acknowledged that Jed may not be able to overcome this moment, but said she knows she made "the right decision."
Kieran and Megan
Relationship status: Married

What happened in the show: In the dating pods, Kieran initially had strong connections with two women: Sophie and Megan. When he gave Megan a sentimental gift, it solidified their bond and alienated Sophie.
Megan didn't grow up with solid examples of healthy romantic relationships and opened up to Kieran about how this had affected her approach to romance.
The couple went on to get engaged and had a strong emotional and physical connection. When Megan said "I love you" to Kieran, it marked the first time she'd done so in a relationship.

While reflecting on their relationship during his vows, Kieran grew emotional and recalled how Megan's "infectious laugh" hooked him from the get-go. "I still can't quite believe how perfect you are for me. You really are one of a kind," he said.
In her vows, Megan vowed to always be Kieran's "biggest cheerleader" and "sidekick through all of life's wild adventures."
"You have opened my eyes to a whole new realm of kindness and understanding that I truly have never felt before," she said.
Both Megan and Kieran said "I do" and celebrated their nuptials with family and friends. In a post-wedding interview, the newlyweds agreed they had no doubt that they were going to get married.
"This has been a fairytale for us and this is our happy ever after," Kieran said.
Sarover and Kal
Relationship status: Married

What happens in the show: When Kal first started speaking with Sarover in the pods, he fell for her "thoughtfulness," as he described in a confessional interview. On his wedding day, he mentioned this trait and many others that he had found in his bride.

While dating in the pods, the couple spoke about their cultural backgrounds and Sarover admitted that she's mostly dated Indian men in the past. Kal, who is half Pakistani, wondered how their cultural differences might concern their parents, but they both agreed that they felt such a strong bond that it shouldn't matter.
Outside the pods, the couple's relationship blossomed. On their wedding day, Sarover said Kal made her "feel safe" and his presence "brings me peace."
At the altar, the bride and groom read their own vows to each other.
“Your personality, your qualities is exactly the father I’ve always envisioned for my future children. You made me feel like the luckiest girl in the world,” she said.
When Kal ripped his vows up, it concerned Sarover at first, but he quickly told her it was all in his head and went on to describe how she's changed his life, calling her his "posh pod princess."
Sarover was first to say, "I do," followed by Kal. In a confessional interview following the wedding, Sarover said, "The fact that we fell in love, it shows love has no boundaries."
"True love shouldn't and does not discriminate," Kal added.
Billy and Ashleigh
Relationship status: Married

What happened in the show: Billy and Ashleigh had instant chemistry in the pods, but had to overcome one little obstacle: her profession as a cabin crew manager on an airline. Billy, who works as an army physical trainer, was concerned that their schedules would make it difficult to see each other regularly. Over time, he decided to give things a try and they got engaged.

Once they moved in, the couple realized they both have different approaches to life, with Billy being more rigid than Ashleigh, especially when it comes to food and diet. Some of their conversations left Ashleigh wondering how they could blend their two approaches together. Billy, who was previously divorced, was also cautious about getting into another marriage if he wasn't totally sure.

Flash forward to the wedding day and Ashleigh admitted that she wasn't sure where Billy's head was at. She said she felt "sick, worried, anxious" but hoped that they would say "I do." Meanwhile, Billy said he had concerns about their relationship, even if he loved Ashleigh more than anyone he's ever loved before.

In a confessional interview, Ashleigh said she's "always known" she wanted marriage from their relationship. Meanwhile, Billy said he hoped Ashleigh could forgive him if he did end up saying "no" at the altar.
When the moment arrived, the bride and groom spoke openly to each other. Ashleigh went first and said she fell in love with Billy for his "courage," "honesty" and "self-growth."
"Thank you, Billy, for restoring my faith and trust in love because I had given up, and for seeing me for who I am every single day," she said.
Billy applauded his bride for her "values," "heart" and "kindness to others."
"Coming into this experiment, I knew I had my insecurities, and you've made me a better man because of it," he said.
Both Billy and Ashleigh said "I do" and took a risk on love. In a post-ceremony interview, the bride asked the groom what made him say "yes."
"I was split down the middle for fear. I've been divorced before. I don't want to be divorced again. But I love you and I want to spend the rest of my life with you," he said.
Javen and Katisha
Relationship status: Broken up

What happened in the show: In Episode 9, viewers learned that Javen and Katisha dropped out of the dating experiment before the weddings stage. It didn't come as much of a surprise since the couple had a rocky road after getting engaged.

In the pods, Katisha had strong connections with both Javen and Demola. The former was more tightlipped about his feelings, while the latter was much more expressive. As the experiment progressed, Katisha seemed ready to commit to Demola and made him believe he was the one for her. Then she spoke with Javen, who was able to change her mind. She soon got engaged to Javen.

After the engaged couples moved in together, they got together with their cast mates one night. Javen decided to go out afterwards but Katisha opted to stay inside. Megan later told Katisha that Javen had been flirting with several of the women who were present at the late-night outing.
When Katisha confronts Javen, he says nothing inappropriate happened. She later decides to leave the experiment and leaves him the engagement ring and a note on a table.

title: Why Taylor Swift's Engagement Is Hitting Fans So Hard
summary: Fans share their emotional reactions to Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's Aug. 26 engagement news on social media. Here's why it means so much to fans.
story: When Olive Manella saw that Taylor Swift announced her engagement to Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce on Aug. 26, she started crying.

Manella shared a video of her hearing the news from her dad. While she thought he was joking with her at first, she soon pulled up the couple’s shared Instagram post of the moment and realized the news was true. She quickly became emotional.
“She’s literally written breakup song after breakup song and had her heart shattered so many times. And she’s finally in love and engaged,” Manella said through tears in a viral Instagram video.

Swift, 35, announced the step in her relationship with Kelce after over two years of dating. Manella, 26, said in the video that their happy ending is confirmation you should “wait for the right person.”
“Taylor, if you’re watching this, which you’re not, but if you ever see this … thank you for being an example,” Manella said.
For Some Fans, Swift's Engagement Made the World Stop

Manella is not alone in her enthusiastic reaction to the major development in Swift and Kelce’s love story. As the news spread, many fans also had emotional reactions to the celebrity couple’s relationship update.

Sararosa Davies, 27, a fan of Swift’s from Portland, Oregon, tells TODAY.com that when she saw a text from her fiancé at work about the proposal, she immediately “started crying and had to close the office door.”
She says she informed all of her coworkers and listened to Swift’s music throughout the rest of the day. “Focusing on work is very hard right now,” she adds.

Similarly, Amelia Villano, a Swiftie from Florida, says she was baking on a TikTok live when she learned about the engagement. She tells TODAY.com that she "held back sobs" as she told her husband the news.
“I’m getting choked up talking about it,” she says. “It just feels like such good news for someone who is a stranger but doesn’t feel like a stranger.”
Thrilled fan reactions took off online, with the Swiftie community coming together to express their shared joy for the pop star.
The joint announcement post itself received over 14 million likes in the first hour it was posted, quickly making its way to the top 20 list of most-liked posts on Instagram of all time.
The emotion is palpable in videos of people learning the news in workplaces and school hallways. One user shared a video of herself screaming with excitement on the floor after she found out.
Even Reese Witherspoon joined in on the fun, saying she needed to take time off from work — a common sentiment.
“you want me to work? taylor swift just told the world she is engaged to be married and you want me to work?” one fan posted on X, receiving over 13,000 reposts.

Natalie Marshall, the creator known as @corporatenatalie, shared her impression of “every woman in the world right now” reacting to the news at work. The imitation included Marshall interrupting the meeting to talk about the announcement and singing Swift’s song “Love Story” mid-conference call.
“Did I finish my compliance training when the biggest union of two individuals is about to occur in history? No, I haven’t gotten to it yet,” Marshall joked at the end of the video.
The post received over 100,000 likes on Instagram, with other viewers chiming in with their enthusiastic reactions to Swift’s announcement.
“She posted during America’s lunch hour and fed us rightfully,” one user commented.
“I am more excited for Taylor than I was for my own engagement lol,” added another.
Some fans agreed that the news feels like a loved one was announcing their engagement.
“I feel like I’m congratulating my very close personal friend,” one user said in a video on TikTok. “She has no clue who I am, but I’m so happy for her.”
Why Does Swift’s Engagement Mean So Much to Fans?
Swifties say the news hits hard because they feel like they have bonded with the singer throughout her 20-year music career.

The connection is especially strong for millennial women, Caroline Dettman tells TODAY.com, because their generation has aged with Swift, experiencing life events around the same time as she was singing about them.
Dettman, who, like Swift, is also in her mid-30s, says she started tearing up a little bit when Swift’s post popped up on Instagram.

“A lot of women my age have gone through the eras with Taylor,” she says. “‘Reputation’ came out when we were all getting out of our first serious relationships. ‘Lover’ came out when we were finding our next great love. It bonds myself and others like me to her.”
She says she, along with other fans, have “the parasocial relationship of parasocial relationships” with Swift. Seeing her find happiness with Kelce feels like seeing a friend find love, she says.
“It brings hope and joy to us at the same time,” Dettmann adds. “It just really feels like we’ve grown up with her.”

“She puts words to our past, be it good or bad, and warns of what may be or the joys to come,” Kelsey Barr, a fan of Swift’s from New Jersey, echoes to TODAY.com. “She has been a big sister to so many of us.”
The Message the Engagement Is Sending? 'The Right Person Is Worth the Wait'

After the engagement, fans turned to Swift's past lyrics as evidence of a romantic journey. In songs like "The Prophecy," she expressed the fear that she might never find love — and now, they say, she has. Fans say Swift's story gives them hope for their own love lives.

“The Taylor Swift engagement is hitting so hard for us bc it gives us all hope that we will someday get there,” one user wrote in the text of a TikTok video. “The girl who wrote all the songs we cry over boys to finally has her happily ever after and so will we.”
“She has been through so much and so have we,” one fan commented on the video.
“We’re really going to find someone someday who will treat us well,” another commented.
“She’s proof it gets better,” another user shared in a reaction video.
Hannah Pennell, 36, a fan of Swift’s from Florida, tells TODAY.com that Swift’s engagement sends the message that the “right person is worth the wait.”
"As someone getting engaged in your mid to late 30s, we all know what the girl went through. She still managed to keep her heart open and kept trying," she says.
“I think this gives lots of women hope and excitement,” Pennell continues. “We are so privileged to have had her document everything because it’s stuff we all can relate to and be encouraged by.”

title: ‘Saturday Night Live’ Season 51: Everything To Know About the Premiere, Cast and More
summary: "Saturday Night Live" is returning to NBC this fall. See what the show's creator, Lorne Michaels, has said about the new season so far.
story: After Lorne Michaels said he plans on shaking up the "Saturday Night Live" lineup for Season 51, several cast members have announced they will not be returning to the sketch comedy show.

In an August interview with Puck News, the "SNL" creator talked about the future of the hit show, which has been running since 1975. He confirmed at the time that he planned to "shake things up" after the landmark 50th season.

"I wanted people coming back and being part of (the 50th season)," Michaels told the outlet. "And that meant there couldn’t be those kind of disruptions (to the cast), or anything that was going to take the focus off (the 50th season)."
He added that he feels "pressure to reinvent" after Season 50.
"Yeah, for sure," Michaels answered. "It’ll be announced in a week or so."
Michaels has seemingly started finalizing the Season 51 cast, and two “SNL” cast members have shared that they won’t be returning.
Scroll below to see everything there is to know about the upcoming season of "SNL."
When is 'Saturday Night Live' returning?
Season 51 of "Saturday Night Live" will premiere on NBC on Oct. 4, per NBC Insider.
Who Is In the Cast of 'Saturday Night Live' Season 51?
Though Michaels has yet to confirm the new cast of "SNL," he told Puck on Aug. 22 that cast shakeups would be "announced in a week or so."
When asked specifically if comedian James Austin Johnson will reprise his role as U.S. President Donald Trump, Michaels said, "yes."
Since that interview, cast members Devon Walker and Emil Wakim have announced they won't be in Season 51.

In an Aug. 27 Instagram post, Wakim, who spent one season on the show as a featured player, said he learned he wouldn't be returning to the show when he was out celebrating a friend's birthday at Six Flags.
"It was a gut punch of a call to get but I’m so grateful for my time there," he said.
As for Walker, who joined the show in 2022, he said leaving "SNL" after three years feels like a divorce.

“To me, jobs in this industry feel like a bunch of little marriages. Some of ‘em last for a long time if we’re lucky, but most of them are fleeting," he said on Instagram on Aug. 25. "Permanent until they’re not. That’s the deal. You know what it is when you sign up."
"me and baby broke up," he added in the caption, accompanying a photo of himself next to the "Saturday Night Live" title card.
"SNL" has not yet announced its full Season 51 cast lineup yet.
The cast of Season 50 consisted of:

Michael CheMikey DayAndrew DismukesChloe FinemanHeidi GardnerMarcello HernándezJames Austin JohnsonColin JostMichael LongfellowEgo NwodimSarah ShermanKenan ThompsonDevon WalkerBowen YangPlus, featured players Ashley Padilla, Emil Wakim and Jane Wickline
Michael Che
Mikey Day
Andrew Dismukes
Chloe Fineman
Heidi Gardner
Marcello Hernández
James Austin Johnson
Colin Jost
Michael Longfellow
Ego Nwodim
Sarah Sherman
Kenan Thompson
Devon Walker
Bowen Yang
Plus, featured players Ashley Padilla, Emil Wakim and Jane Wickline
Where Can I Watch 'Saturday Night Live' Season 51?
After its Oct. 4 debut, new episodes of "SNL" will air Saturdays on NBC and will be available to stream on Peacock the next day. (Peacock and TODAY.com share a parent company, NBCUniversal.)
Is Lorne Michaels Retiring?
Lorne Michaels created "Saturday Night Live," and 50 years later, he's said he's not done with the program. Ahead of the anniversary special, many wondered about Michaels' future with the show.
In February, Michaels, 80, told the New York Times, “I may be wrong. But I don’t feel I’m done.”
In the August interview, Puck asked if he plans on giving some added responsibilities to some of his team members.

“That’s already been happening (in) the past year or so,” he said. “More people are involved in the choices and in the decisions. But I’m not worried about A.I. because A.I. can’t guess what I’m gonna do between 10 and 11 (on show nights)… because I have no idea!”
“There’s a lot of people in that room with a lot of opinions. I make the final decision, obviously. But it’s not as if people don’t let me know how strongly they feel,” he added.

title: Benson Boone or Adele? Singer’s Cover of ‘When We Were Young’ Sounds Exactly Like the Original
summary: Benson Boone pulled off an impressive cover of Adele's "When We Were Young" during his concert in Columbus, Ohio.
story: Any fans who went for a bathroom break at a recent Benson Boone concert might have thought Adele crashed the show.
The 23-year-old American singer left fans stunned when he channeled the 37-year-old British icon with a cover of her song "When We Were Young" at his concert Aug. 25 in Columbus, Ohio.
The chart-topping singer's version had fans doing a double take after it sounded so much like the original.
"Why does he actually sound like Adele," one fan commented on a TikTok clip of the cover song.
"A male singing this live in the original key is genuinely insane, what a voice," another wrote.
"I SWEAR I can hear Adele’s voice in this," another incredulous fan commented.
"Have you ever seen Benson Boone and Adele in the same room?" one person joked on X.
"Did he just kelly clarkson adele," one fan on TikTok wrote in reference to Clarkson's "Kellyoke" series of covers that often outshine the original hits.
TODAY's Carson Daly, who is also the longtime host of the talent competition "The Voice" on NBC, noted how challenging it can be to cover a song by Adele due to her powerful voice.

"The dude is talented," he said about Boone on TODAY on Aug. 27. "Doing 'The Voice' and anybody comes up and tries to sing like an Adele song or a Sia song, we're like, 'No.' Some can do it, and he's one of them."
Boone cited Adele as an influence in a 2024 interview with Grammys.com.

"Growing up I listened to a lot of Billy Joel, Sam Smith, Adele, Stevie Wonder, and Queen; these are artists who use their voice as the main instrument for their songs," he said. "I think I took a lot of aspects from that into my own music and that's kind of how I operate."

title: What Time Will 'My Life with the Walter Boys' Season 2 Out on Netflix?
summary: What times does "My Life with the Walter Boys" come out on Netflix? Here's when Season 2 of the show premieres, exactly what time and what date.
story: "My Life with the Walter Boys" is returning to Netflix this week, two years after the first season came out.

The TV series, which is based on Ali Novak’s 2012 novel, centers around Jackie Howard (Nikki Rodriguez), a 15-year-old who moves from New York City to Colorado after her family dies in a car accident.
Anticipation for Season 2 is high following a juicy cliffhanger in the Season 1 finale. Ready to binge-watch it as soon as it premieres? Here's everything you need to know to tune in.
What Time Does Season 2 of 'My Life with the Walter Boys' Drop on Netflix?
"My Life with the Walter Boys" hits Netflix on Thursday, Aug. 28, 2025 at 3 a.m. ET/12 a.m. PT.
How Many Episodes Are in Season 2?
Similar to Season 1, Season 2 features 10 episodes.
How Did Season 1 End?
The Season 1 finale of "My Life with the Walter Boys" was action-packed.

For starters, Hayley (Zoë Soul) and Will (Johnny Link) got married at the Walter family ranch, with friends and family in attendance. Jackie's uncle Richard (Alex Quijano) was on hand for the festivities and to talk business with Will, who had an idea to save his family's ranch.

At the wedding, Alex Walter (Ashby Gentry) had a few too many drinks then told Jackie he loved her. Later that night, Jackie realized that Cole Walter (Noah LaLonde) previously fixed a broken teapot that once belonged to her sister. Touched by the thoughtful gesture, she went to talk to him and they ended up kissing.

Much to Alex's surprise, Jackie was nowhere to be found the next day. As it turned out, she boarded a plane to New York with her uncle and Danny Walter (Connor Stanhope), who was attending a theater program in the city over the summer.
Elsewhere, Tara (Ashley Holliday Tavares) was surprised to find Nik in her tent after the wedding. He came bearing good news: He didn't take the job in London.

title: Jason Kelce Tells the Story Behind His 'Ridiculous-Looking' Dyed Beard
summary: Jason Kelce explained to brother Travis why he dyed his beard a darker color on the Aug. 27 episode of their "New Heights" podcast.
story: Jason Kelce is setting the record straight about why he dyed his beard, which fans immediately noticed after watching him on the "New Heights" podcast with brother Travis Kelce.

The retired Philadelphia Eagles star and current "Monday Night Countdown" analyst shared on the Aug. 27 episode of "New Heights" why his beard was suddenly black on the Aug. 13 edition of the podcast after having sported gray hairs for a while.

"For those of you that don’t know, I dyed my beard, which many people did mention on the podcast," Jason Kelce said. "The dyed beard came from an idea for Garage Beer where I was going to do this bit where we go back in time, so I wanted to be younger."
Garage Beer is the craft beer company owned by Jason and Travis Kelce.

"Initially I was going to shave my beard completely, and then I was like, 'Yeah, I’m not doing that, I hate my face too much,'" Jason Kelce said. "I’m going to keep the beard, but I’ll dye it to make me look younger, which did work. Objectively, that’s going to come off great."
Jason Kelce's jet-black beard was clearly noticeable in the record-setting episode in which they welcomed Travis' now-fiancée, pop superstar Taylor Swift, on the podcast.

Retired NFL quarterback and current "Thursday Night Football" analyst Ryan Fitzpatrick, who sports a salt-and-pepper beard of his own, jokingly chided Jason Kelce at the time, writing “Betrayed” on X.
“I promise the dye was for a good reason, don’t hate me,” Jason Kelce replied at the time.
Jason Kelce, 37, expanded on the reasoning for the new look on the Aug. 27 "New Heights" episode.

"We didn’t play chemistry very well, and I ended up coming out a little darker than I was expecting," Jason Kelce said. "I miss my grays. I can’t wait for this to grow back out. It is kind of growing on me though, I do feel like I look pretty good."
"My boy’s feeling himself," Travis Kelce joked.
Jason Kelce wanted to make it clear why he dyed the beard.
"So yes, I did dye my hair," he said. "I want to emphasize though ... I didn’t do it out of vanity, I did it for a bit. That’s all I’m saying. I think there’s a distinct difference."
"It’s OK to be a little insecure about your grays," Travis Kelce needled him.
"That’s not why I did it!" Jason Kelce said. "I like my grays."
Earlier in the episode, Jason Kelce joked about how he went a little overboard on the coloring.
"This is not the right color. It's way too dark," he said. "It looks like I took shoe polish to my face."
He said it was a mix of light brown coloring similar to Travis Kelce's hair and dark brown coloring.

"I came out of the shower. Immediately I looked like Billy Mays," Jason Kelce joked in reference to the famous infomercial pitchman with a black beard. "It was the most ridiculous-looking thing I had ever seen in my life."

title: Jason Kelce Talks About Taylor Swift ‘Dethroning’ Wife Kylie Kelce on 'New Heights'
summary: Jason Kelce explained how Taylor Swift smashed a record set by his wife, Kylie, when she appeared on his "New Heights" podcast with his brother, Travis Kelce.
story: Taylor Swift is already upping her future sister-in-law.

On the Aug. 27 episode of his “New Heights” podcast that he hosts with his brother, Travis Kelce, Jason Kelce noted how Swift’s appearance on the podcast on Aug. 13 shattered the record for most-watched episode, set by his own wife, Kylie Kelce.
“Sad news for the Kelce household. Kylie has been dethroned,” Jason Kelce said tongue-in-cheek. “We knew it was going to happen. Ky was holding strong. I think she had, like, seven million views.”

Kylie Kelce was a guest on "New Heights" on two occasions, in September 2023 and again in December 2024. Swift’s appearance on “New Heights,” meanwhile, sent the Internet into a frenzy, most notably for her announcement that she would be releasing her 12th studio album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” which will come out Oct. 3.

Indeed, it was a seismic pop culture moment, as Guinness World Record verified Swift’s appearance set the record for the most concurrent views for a podcast on YouTube, with 1.3 million people watching at the same time. The episode has more than 21 million views overall. Since that episode became available, Swift and Travis Kelce announced their engagement.
Jason Kelce noted that his wife’s appearance on “New Heights” outdrew other episodes with guests like Adam Sandler and LeBron James.
“She had a great run,” he said.
“She got dethroned pretty good. And it was very quickly. It was quickly,” he added.
Travis Kelce, meanwhile, had the perfect way for Kylie Kelce to boost her numbers.
“Kylie just has to come out with an album,” he said before his brother noted that she has a good voice.
“I don’t know that she’s quite the lyricist or performer that Tay is, but she can sing,” Jason Kelce said.
Kylie Kelce, meanwhile, is just fine knowing Swift took the title from her.

“Officially no longer the record holder for the most-watched episode of the other podcast. There’s no way it’s even close, and I love that for me,” she said on the Aug. 14 episode of her own podcast, “Not Gonna Lie.”

title: Michael Jackson’s Son Prince Is Engaged! See His Sweet Announcement Post
summary: Michael Jackson's son Prince has gotten engaged to his longtime girlfriend, Molly Schirmang, after 8 years of dating.
story: Michael Jackson's oldest son has found the one.
On Aug. 26, Prince Jackson announced he and his longtime girlfriend, Molly Schirmang, are engaged in a sweet post he shared on Instagram.

"8 years down ♾️ to go. Molly and I have spent a lot of time together and made incredible memories," he wrote. "We’ve traveled the world, graduated and grown so much together. I’m excited for this next chapter in our lives as we continue to grow and make great memories. I love you babs 😘."
The heartwarming post featured a bunch of cute photos of them over the years, including a pic of them kissing in a park and another of them about to kiss at Prince Jackson's college graduation.
Prince Jackson's cousin, Taryll Jackson, the son of Michael Jackson's late brother, Tito Jackson, commented, “😊💙🙏🏽 Congrats!!!”
Prince Jackson and Schirmang have been dating since 2017. In 2018, he marked their one-year anniversary in an Instagram post with a photo of them at the Carmel Highlands in California.
"I had such an amazing time in San Fran celebrating our year together❤️," he captioned it.

As one of Michael Jackson's three kids, Prince Jackson told "The Mix" on FOX Soul in 2021 that he likes to keep his father's legacy alive. One good life lesson, he says his father taught him is to never stop learning.
“The one that is my guiding principle is that you never stop learning," he said in the interview. "I graduated, and that doesn’t mean that I stopped learning."
“And my father also would say something along the lines of, ‘The minute that you stop learning is the minute that you’re going to start dying,'” he added.

title: Travis Kelce Reveals His Favorite Song From Fiancée Taylor Swift's New Album — 'At Least Right Now'
summary: Travis Kelce revealed on "New Heights" he has one song, "Opalite," from fiancée Taylor Swift's new album on repeat, sparking fan theories.
story: Travis Kelce is already listening to fiancée Taylor Swift's new album on repeat, and he's quite fond of one particular song.

Earlier this month, Swift appeared on her beau's "New Heights" podcast to announce her new album, "The Life of a Showgirl." During that episode Travis Kelce gave his initial review of the record: "I’ve been fortunate enough to hear every single song on here. So I know they’re all 12 bangers," he said.

But in the latest episode of the podcast, the Kansas City Chiefs tight end got more specific. Travis Kelce revealed to his co-host and brother, Jason Kelce, which of the album's songs has most captivated his attention.
“I’m not a politician, Jason. I think ‘Opalite’ might be my favorite, though, at least right now. Every time it comes on, I always catch myself,” he said.
The professional football player is clearly proud of his fiancée's work and took a moment to applaud her upcoming album.

“I’m gonna go ahead and just keep poking the bear to all the Swifties. I keep listening to this album. And I know she mentioned that it’s gonna be a lot more pop beats and everything, but it’s just, it’s still so poetic, and how she (executes) her melodies and her references and stuff," he said. "It’s just so much fun to listen to, man. I’ve been dancing all throughout the house."
Some Swifties already have a theory about what — or whom — Travis Kelce's favorite song could be about.

Many fans have taken to social media to suggest that "Opalite" may be a nod to Travis Kelce himself, and specifically one of his birthstones: opal. (The birthstones for October are opal and tourmaline, per the Gemological Institute of America.)
"That’s a fan myth but real fandom logic though: Opal = Travis’s birthstone + Taylor’s jewelry + album timing = Opalite feels like a love code," one fan wrote on X.
Another commented, "so cute that he says Opal is his favorite song because, as a fellow libra like Travis, I know opal is his birthstone."
Swift is known for dropping subtle clues, or Easter eggs, for her fans. During her "New Heights" appearance, she described her approach to planting these hints for fans.

“I’m never going to plant an Easter egg that ties back to my personal life,” Swift said at the time. “It’s always going to be toward music or something I’m coming up with, something I have coming up, a plan I have coming together — something that you don’t know that I’m saying for a specific reason that you’ll hear later and you’ll go back and be like, ‘Oh my god.’”

She's also known for writing songs inspired by her love life. For example, "So High School" was long speculated to also be about Travis Kelce, a fan theory she seemingly confirmed when she used the song to announce their engagement Aug. 26.
"bro… opal birthstone i see you," one X user wrote after Travis Kelce revealed his favorite song.

It's worth noting that opal and opalite are slightly different. Per the Gemological Institute of America, opalite first appeared in 1988 at the Gem and Lapidary Dealers Association Tucson show. It was marketed as a "plastic imitation opal that shows true play-of-color."

"Subsequent gemological testing proved that this material was virtually identical to the plastic imitation opal previously described in the literature that was known to be manufactured in Japan," the website reads.
Per the International Gem Society, opalite typically refers to a "plastic or glass opal simulant."
"However, there is a variety of natural opal sometimes called opalite. This common variety of opal comes in green, lavender, or purple colors and can also show a cat’s eye," the website reads.
Swift and Travis Kelce are clearly smitten with each other. The day before the latest "New Heights" episode dropped, they announced their engagement in a joint Instagram post.
"Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married," they wrote in the caption.

title: Bad Bunny Reveals Why He Was 'A Little' Nervous About Acting in ‘Caught Stealing’: EXCLUSIVE
summary: In a preview of a Sunday TODAY interview with Willie Geist, Bad Bunny spoke about why he was nervous to star in the movie "Caught Stealing." Plus, the Puerto Rican rapper shares how he feels about acting compared to performing on stage.
story: Having already established himself as one of the biggest musical acts in the world, Bad Bunny is now eyeing the silver screen.

The Puerto Rican superstar is expanding his acting endeavors using his birth name, Benito Antonio Martinez Ocasio, with a role in Academy Award-nominated director Darren Aronofsky’s upcoming film, “Caught Stealing.”

Bad Bunny plays a Puerto Rican gangster named Colorado in the movie, which also stars Austin Butler, Regina King, Zoë Kravitz, Griffin Dunne and Action Bronson. During a preview of his Sunday TODAY interview with Willie Geist, which will air Aug. 31 in an NBC News exclusive, the rapper said he was a bit apprehensive about taking the part.

title: Watch Jason Kelce's 'Giant Congratulations' Message for Travis and Taylor Swift After Engagement
summary: Jason Kelce congratulates his brother Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift about their engagement news on his "New Heights" podcast.
story: Jason Kelce had a sweet message for his brother Travis Kelce and new fiancée Taylor Swift.
In an Aug. 27 Instagram post for the Kelces' “New Heights” podcast, the elder Kelce shared a special message to his brother and Swift following the news of their recent engagement.

"We felt it necessary as a team here at 'New Heights' to get together and send Travis and Taylor a giant congratulations for being engaged!" he yelled. "The proposal heard ‘round the world. F--- yeah!"

Jason noted that Travis wasn't present to comment on his recent engagement since the podcast was recorded on Monday, Aug. 25 -- his day off. However, fans can tune in next week to hopefully hear Travis Kelce talk about his engagement himself.
On Aug. 26, the Kansas City Chiefs star and Swift announced they had gotten engaged in a sweet post they shared on Instagram.
It said, "Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married 🧨."

The post featured a series of photos of the couple standing in a majestic garden and embracing. In one of the snaps, Travis Kelce is seen proposing to Swift while down on one knee and in another, the pop star is seen showing off her ring, which is an old mine diamond designed by Kindred Lubeck of Artifex Fine Jewelry.
According to Travis Kelce's dad, Ed Kelce, his son proposed about two weeks ago at a garden in Lee’s Summit, Missouri.

“He got her out there, they were about to go out to dinner, and he said, ‘Let’s go out and have a glass of wine,’ ... they got out there, and that’s when he asked her, and it was beautiful,” he told ABC News 5 Cleveland. “They started FaceTiming me and their mother and her folks to make sure everybody knew. So, to see them together is great.”

title: Travis Kelce's Dad Reveals When Travis Proposed to Taylor Swift
summary: Travis Kelce's dad, Ed Kelce, revealed that his son and Taylor Swift got engaged weeks before they announced the news on Aug. 26.
story: Ed Kelce is sharing some insight on his son Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's engagement.

On Aug. 26, the couple announced that they were officially engaged after two years of dating. Sharing photos from their stunning floral-filled proposal, the joint caption read: “Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married.”
The newly-engaged couple did not share additional details about the proposal or where and when it took place.
Swifties, however, began going down a rabbit hole, dissecting the color of her nails, the time the announcement came out, as well as her “New Heights” appearance to see if there were any signs.
Yet shortly after the engagement news, Ed Kelce spilled some details on how it apparently went down.
When did Travis Kelce Propose to Taylor Swift?
According to the Kansas City Chiefs tight end’s dad, he revealed in an interview with ABC News 5 Cleveland that Travis Kelce proposed to Swift about two weeks ago.
“Travis actually did the proposal, oh, maybe two weeks, not quite two weeks ago. He was going to put it off ‘til this week,” he said.
He explained that his son was planning to “make some grand thing, to make it a big special event.”
“And I told him repeatedly, you know, you could do it on the side of the road, do it any place that makes it a special event,” Ed Kelce said.
While he did not share the exact date, the Kelce patriarch said he was at a Philadelphia Eagles public practice on a Sunday night when they called him with the news.
According to the NFL team's website, they most recently held a public practice on Sunday, Aug. 10.
Where and How Did Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift Get Engaged?
Ed Kelce reportedly told the outlet that the couple got engaged at a garden in Lee’s Summit, Missouri.

“He got her out there, they were about to go out to dinner, and he said, ‘Let’s go out and have a glass of wine,’ ... they got out there, and that’s when he asked her, and it was beautiful,” Ed Kelce said. “They started FaceTiming me and their mother and her folks to make sure everybody knew. So, to see them together is great.”
According to Ed Kelce, he was prepared for Travis Kelce to pop the question, expecting him to do it during last year’s NFL season.
“That’s when it became obvious they were just crazy about each other,” he said.
In the interview, Ed Kelce said “about a week ago,” he asked Travis Kelce when they would be announcing the news to the world.
“He said, ‘Whenever Taylor says so,’” he said.

title: Kris Jenner Breaks Silence About New Facelift
summary: Kris Jenner opens up about her facelift, why she did it, and how her daughters supported her during the procedure.
story: Kris Jenner finally unveiled the secret behind her newly revitalized appearance, which has sent the internet into a frenzy over the past several months.
Serving as Vogue Arabia’s cover star, Kris Jenner opened up about a recent facelift, saying the procedure was her version of “aging gracefully.”
“I had a facelift about 15 years ago, so it was time for a refresh. I decided to do this facelift because I want to be the best version of myself, and that makes me happy,” she told the publication.

“Just because you get older, it doesn’t mean you should give up on yourself,” Kris Jenner continued. “If you feel comfortable in your skin and you want to age gracefully — meaning you don’t want to do anything — then don’t do anything. But for me, this is aging gracefully. It’s my version.”

In May, the Kardashian-Jenner family matriarch seemed to debut the fresh look when accompanying her daughter Kim Kardashian to a court hearing addressing her 2016 robbery in Paris. Since then, Kris Jenner hasn't been shy about showing off the results on social media.
During her interview with Vogue Arabia, Kris Jenner confirmed that she went under the knife with Dr. Steven Levine, the viral New York City-based plastic surgeon who conducted the procedure.
She didn't go into the cosmetic operation alone, though. Naturally, the endeavor became a family affair.

“Of course my daughter Kylie went with me, while Kim was present at all times on FaceTime,” she said of her daughters Kylie Jenner, whom she shares with ex-husband Caitlyn Jenner, and Kim Kardashian, whom she shared with ex-husband Rob Kardashian.

While speaking with the publication, Kris Jenner explained that she chose to disclose information regarding her facelift “because I feel it can be very inspirational to people who aren’t feeling so great about themselves.”
“Even when I had my hip replacement, we filmed it. I have the conviction that sharing these things can be helpful,” she added.
Less than two months from her 70th birthday on Nov. 5, “The Kardashians” reality star further detailed what aging means to her at this point in her life.
“I don’t know what 70 is supposed to feel like, but I feel great and I’m happy to be there,” she said. “I just have to try my best to do what I can to feel good and healthy."
Reflecting on her priorities nowadays, Kris Jenner called her family “my blessing,” adding, “If I can be a part of their lives in the best way possible, then I’m thrilled.”
Kris Jenner's openness might be inherited, as one of her daughters nearly three months ago revealed her own experience with cosmetic procedures.
In June, Kylie Jenner outlined — in great detail — specifics around her breast augmentation.
In a TikTok video, a user complimented Kylie Jenner on her breast implants and asked how she achieved “the most perfect, natural looking boob job ever.”
The Kylie Cosmetics founder commented, “445 cc, moderate profile, half under the muscle!!!!! silicone!!! garth fisher!!! hope this helps lol.”

In regards to breast augmentations, 445 cc refers to the size of the silicone implant, while the remainder of Kylie Jenner's description describes the implant's placement. Garth Fisher is the name of the surgeon who performed the procedure.
In a follow-up post on Instagram, Fisher responded to the comment, saying he was “honored to be acknowledged by Kylie —her kind words were unexpected but truly appreciated.”
Kris Jenner commented on Fisher’s post, gushing about the surgeon’s work on her 2011 facelift.

“Garth you are such a superstar class act!! You did my first facelift in 2011… 14 years ago!!! and made it the most amazing experience ever and even gave us access to film so that others could get a peek inside what it’s like and not be afraid,” Kris Jenner wrote.
She continued, “You have taken great care of us always and remain such a close and treasured friend!! Such an incredible talent!!”

title: Taylor Swift's Engagement Ring Analyzed by Jewelry Pros
summary: Taylor Swift's engagement ring analyzed by jewelers. What cut is it? How many carats is it? How much did it cost? What are other details?
story: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are engaged after two years of dating, and she has the ring to prove it.
Swift posted a series of engagement photos on Aug. 26. Slide 3 of the carousel is a close-up of the diamond ring itself.
The old mine diamond is set in a ring designed by Kindred Lubeck of Artifex Fine Jewelry, TODAY.com can confirm. The diamond is a brilliant cushion cut.

Old mine cuts are notable because they are antique diamonds dating back to the time that diamonds were hand-cut and polished. Jeweler Hannah Florman tells TODAY.com old mine diamonds "send a signal that the wearer values individuality over mass-produced perfection," since each is cut by hand.
"This ring honors craftsmanship and subtle beauty that’s not about trends," Florman says.
Jewelry specialist Laura Taylor says old mine cuts are a "hallmark of antique jewelry," and are known for "having a romantic glow rather than the sparkle we associate with engagement rings today."
The vintage look is underlined by the ring’s thick gold cigar band, an increasingly popular choice for rings. Dua Lipa's engagement ring, for example, has this type of band.
But Florman says the detailing on Swift's ring gives it a "different look than the trending rings we're seeing right now." The engraved band gives it a "real storybook quality," Taylor says.
Plus, the diamond has both prongs and a button-back setting — essentially, a layer of metal surrounding the stone itself, which is another hallmark of older rings.

"As a self-proclaimed ‘English teacher’ and lover of art and history, it’s not surprising to see Travis select an antique ring similar to that of the Victorian era. This ring style feels reminiscent of a bygone era tied to the 18th and 19th centuries when diamonds were cut by candlelight," Florman says.
Simone Kendle, CEO of Wove Made Inc., the jewelry brand behind the viral TNT bracelet Swift and Kelce once wore, agrees that the vintage feel mirrors Swift's aesthetic and value as an artist.
"It’s not trendy or flashy; it’s rooted in history and romance, which is very her," Kendle says.
She says the thick band adds to an "old-money vibe" and the feeling the ring is a "vintage heirloom."
"It’s not about following current trends, it’s about leaning into heritage," Kendle says.
In terms of the diamond’s carat size and pricing, the jewelers give a range of estimates.
Florman estimates the ring is 8 carats and between $500,000 to $1 million.
Kendle says it could be between 7 and 8 carats. "A diamond of that size and character would be valued in the millions, depending on its color and clarity — it’s truly one of a kind," she says.

title: Russian attack on Ukraine's capital kills at least 15 as Trump's peace push stalls
summary: Russia unleashed a massive overnight attack on the Ukrainian capital that killed at least 15 people and injured 38, local officials said early Thursday.
story: KYIV, Ukraine — Russia unleashed a massive overnight attack on the Ukrainian capital that killed at least 15 people, including four children, and injured 38, local officials said early Thursday.

The combined strikes were the most significant to hit Kyiv since President Donald Trump intensified his push for an end to the Kremlin’s war, an effort that has stalled in the past week. A total of 629 drones and missiles were fired at the country overnight, Ukraine's air force said, one of the largest of the war.
The overnight attacks show clearly that Russia has chosen “ballistics over the negotiating table,” Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in a post on X.
Among the three children killed was a 2-year-old, said Tymur Tkachenko, the head of Kyiv’s city administration. Ten other minors were injured, he said in a post on Telegram.
Also damaged were the European Union delegation building and the British Council building in Kyiv. Staff were not harmed, E.U. President Ursula von der Leyen said.
Both Brussels and London summoned their Russian ambassadors.

title: Reuters stopped sharing Gaza locations with Israel after many journalists killed in IDF strikes
summary: International news agency Reuters says that it stopped sharing the locations of its teams in the Gaza Strip with the Israeli military after “so many journalists were killed in IDF strikes.”
story: JERUSALEM — Israeli forces have killed so many journalists that Reuters has stopped sharing the locations of its teams in the Gaza Strip with the country's military, the international news agency told NBC News.
A Reuters cameraman who regularly operated its live position on the roof of Nasser Hospital was one of five journalists among 22 people killed in an Israeli attack on the facility Monday.

“In the early days of the conflict, Reuters, like other news outlets, shared the locations our teams would be using in an effort to ensure they would not be targeted by the [Israel Defense Forces],“ a spokesperson for the London-based news organization, one of the world’s largest, told NBC News late Wednesday.
This included sharing on “multiple occasions” that its journalists were operating out of Nasser Hospital, where the strikes were caught on video by the Arabic-language channel Al Ghad TV.

“We subsequently desisted from giving precise coordinates of our teams after so many journalists were killed in IDF strikes,” added Reuters, which said it ran a live feed from the site for the last 18 months.

In response to a request for comment on the Reuters statement, the IDF said it had “no further comment beyond the statement that has been put out.” Soon after the incident, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said it had been a “tragic mishap.”

In a statement Tuesday, the IDF claimed that an initial inquiry found that troops had identified a camera at the hospital that was being used to observe its troops “in order to direct terrorist activities against them.” It added that “troops operated to remove the threat by striking and dismantling the camera.”
According to five journalists on the ground, there was only one camera — Reuters’ — at the top of the hospital. A senior Hamas official has claimed it did not have a camera in the area.

The Israeli military, which did not provide evidence to substantiate the claims that Hamas ran a camera on the roof of the hospital or address the multiple strikes on the facility, added that an investigation had been ordered into “several gaps” including the “authorization process” before the attack.

According to the internationally recognized Committee to Protect Journalists, 197 journalists have been killed in Israel’s assault on Gaza since it began less than two years ago, making it the deadliest conflict for journalists the CPJ has documented.
More details emerged Thursday about Israel's deadly attack on Nasser Hospital.

Initially, it was determined to have been a “double tap” attack in which the same target was hit twice in quick succession. But an NBC News analysis of newly obtained video has found that there were at least three Israeli munitions fired at the medical complex on Monday.

Following the first Israeli strike on the facility, the video shows two projectiles flying through the air, striking the 4th floor staircase in quick succession at 10:17 a.m. local time Monday morning.
Weapons munitions expert and war crimes investigator Chris Cobb Smith, who has analyzed the video, said the projectiles clearly visible are missiles.
The IDF did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the newest revelations.
Israel has barred the international media from entering Gaza since Hamas' Oct. 7, 2023, terror attack, except for occasional tours chaperoned by the IDF.

On Wednesday, Dr. Mohammed Saqer, director of nursing at Nasser Hospital, said that the IDF should have been aware that the area it was targeting at the hospital was a hub for Palestinian journalists inside the enclave.

“It’s not a secret place. It’s like a clear place, obvious place. Everyone can see this place. Even the Israeli army, by their own drones or by their own cameras, they can see Hussam and other journalists working from the fourth floor. So it’s not a secret,” he said, referring to Hussam al-Masri, the Reuters cameraman killed in the attack.

He added, “The IDF knows our numbers. Yes, sometimes they call us. So if the IDF has any objection about the presence of Hussam and other journalists on the third floor, on the fourth floor, I think they could have contacted us and we could have fixed the issue.

title: Israel faces new pressure over hospital strikes as Trump chairs Gaza meeting
summary: President Donald Trump was set to chair a meeting Wednesday about the future of Gaza, as Israel faced mounting global outcry over strikes on a hospital that killed 20 people, including journalists and medics.
story: TEL AVIV — President Donald Trump was set to chair a meeting Wednesday about the future of Gaza, as Israel faced mounting global outcry over strikes on a hospital that killed 22 people, including journalists and medics.

Israeli and American officials will attend the discussions on the aftermath of the war, Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff said, even as the U.S. ally moves ahead with a new phase of a campaign that has killed tens of thousands of people and pushed the Palestinian enclave’s largest city into famine.

Pope Leo XIV added his voice to a growing chorus of pressure to end the war, while NBC News spoke to eyewitnesses who contradicted the Israeli military's explanation for the attack on Nasser Hospital in southern Gaza.

“It’s a very comprehensive plan we’re putting together,” Witkoff told Fox News late Tuesday, adding that it reflected Trump’s “humanitarian motives.” Hamas, Witkoff said, was “now signaling that they’re open to a settlement” to end the 22-month war. “We’re going to settle this one way or another, certainly before the end of this year,” he added.
Israel has not publicly responded to the latest ceasefire proposal, which the militant group agreed to last week.

Five journalists were among 20 killed on Monday during “double tap” strikes, which was caught on video by the Arabic-language channel Al Ghad TV, whose correspondent Ibrahim al Qanan was live on TV when the second strike hit. He said timestamps on the video showed that there was 7 minutes between the explosions.
Responders, including journalists and rescue workers, waited a few minutes after the first hit before they raced up the stairs only to be caught in the second blast, he added.
The death toll rose to 22 on Wednesday after two of those wounded in Monday's attack died of their injuries, the Health Ministry in Gaza said.

The Israel Defense Forces said in a statement on X that an initial inquiry found that troops had identified a camera at the hospital that was being used to observe its troops “in order to direct terrorist activities against them.” It added that “troops operated to remove the threat by striking and dismantling the camera.”

The statement, which did not provide evidence to substantiate the claims or address the second strike on the facility, added that an investigation had been ordered into “several gaps” including the “authorization process” before the attack.

But according to five journalists on the ground there was only one camera on the hospital’s roof. The Reuters news agency said it had been running a live feed from the site for the last 18 months. A senior Hamas official claimed it did not have a camera in the area.

"Israel was fully aware that Reuters and multiple other news organizations were operating from Nasser hospital, which has been one of the nerve centers for coverage out of Gaza," a Reuters spokesperson said in a statement. "Reuters has frequently broadcast a feed from Nasser hospital during the war, and for the past several weeks had been delivering daily feeds from the hospital position that was hit."
Dr. Mohammed Saqer, director of nursing at Nasser Hospital, told NBC News that the IDF should have been aware that the area it was targeting at the hospital was a hub for journalists.

“It’s not a secret place. It’s like a clear place, obvious place. Everyone can see this place. Even the Israeli army, by their own drones or by their own cameras, they can see Hussam and other journalists working from the fourth floor. So it’s not a secret,” he said, referring to Hussam al-Masri, a Reuters contractor cameraman killed in the attack.

He added, “The IDF knows our numbers. Yes, sometimes they call us. So if the IDF has any objection about the presence of Hussam and other journalists on the third floor, on the fourth floor, I think they could have contacted us and we could have fixed the issue.”

Among the dead were Mariam Dagga, 33, a visual journalist, who freelanced for The Associated Press and other news outlets during the war. Al Jazeera confirmed that one of its journalists, Mohammed Salama, was also among the dead, while Reuters reported that Moaz Abu Taha, a freelancer who worked occasionally for the organization, died in the Israeli bombing along with al-Masri. Ahmad Abu Aziz, who Middle East Eye said worked as a freelancer, was also killed.
Asked about the strikes, Trump said he was “not happy about it,” adding, “We have to end this whole nightmare.”
Other Western leaders were more forceful in their criticism.
On Wednesday, Pope Leo demanded that Israel stop the “collective punishment” and forced displacement of Palestinians in Gaza as he pleaded for an immediate and permanent ceasefire.

“I beg for a permanent ceasefire to be reached, the safe entry of humanitarian aid to be facilitated and humanitarian law to be fully respected,” the first American pontiff said during his weekly general audience attended by thousands of people in the Vatican’s auditorium.

title: What is a 'double tap,' and why has Israel's use of it outraged so many?
summary: Israel bombed Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis, Gaza, and then bombed it again, not the first time it has used an apparent "double tap" strike on Palestinians.
story: It has become an all-too-familiar scene: first responders, medics and journalists rushing to the site of an Israeli attack. But this time, as they rallied to a shattered stairwell at Nasser Hospital bearing stretchers and cameras, Israel struck again — compounding the scene of carnage and enveloping those trying to aid and document.

Global outcry mounted Tuesday over this “double tap” strike on Gaza’s largest remaining medical center, which was caught on video by the Arabic-language channel Al Ghad TV and others who were recording rescue efforts from the first missile when the second struck.
At least 20 people were killed, including five journalists who had worked for various outlets, including The Associated Press, Reuters and Al Jazeera.
On Tuesday, the Israeli military announced it had concluded an initial investigation of the incident, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu earlier called a “tragic mishap.”
U.N. Secretary-General António Guterres demanded an independent inquiry into the Israeli strike, while President Donald Trump said he was “not happy about it.”
Trump’s Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff said on Tuesday that the conflict in Gaza could be resolved by the end of the year.
"We think that we’re going to settle this one way or another, certainly before the end of this year. Hamas is now signaling that they’re open to a settlement," Witkoff told Fox News’ Bret Baier.

He added, "We’ve got a large meeting in the White House tomorrow, chaired by the President, and it’s a very comprehensive plan we’re putting together on the ‘next day’ that I think many people are going to be — they’re going to see how robust it is and how it’s, how well-meaning it is, and it reflects President Trump’s humanitarian motives here."

Israel has barred Western news organizations from entering Gaza, save for occasional tours chaperoned by the Israel Defense Forces, leaving them to rely on Palestinian journalists inside the enclave. The Committee to Protect Journalists, a New York-based nonprofit press freedom group, says 192 journalists have been killed during the war and 90 more have been detained in what it describes as “the most horrific attacks the press has ever faced in recent history.”

title: Will this strip of land bury dreams of a Palestinian state?
summary: Israel has approved a settlement in the occupied West Bank that would cut the territory in two, and could destroy hopes for a future Palestinian state.
story: MAALE ADUMIM, West Bank — The sun-starched strip of sand and brush doesn’t look like much, but if you squint, you can almost glimpse the dreamscape of a future Palestinian capital.

“These spare lands mean that we can build our parliament, we can build our future institutions,” Khalil Toufakji, a Palestinian expert on geography and settlement expansion, told NBC News earlier this month as he gestured across the controversial “East 1,” or E1, section of the occupied West Bank.

“If Israel builds here, it means that everything is finished at the same time,” the 76-year-old expert on Israeli settlements said at an overlook in the Israeli settlement of Maale Adumim. “This means that Jerusalem is surrounded from everywhere. … It means that there is no Palestinian geographic continuity between the north and south.”
The almost 5 square miles of land may seem undesirable and the conflict around it theoretical, but both Israel and the Palestinians regard the area’s fate with the same sense of urgency.

So when Israeli authorities approved the development of 3,400 homes last week, ultranationalist lawmakers celebrated what they saw as the death knell for a nascent Palestinian state and an acceleration of plans for Israel to annex the whole of the West Bank.

The development “practically erases the two-state delusion and consolidates the Jewish people’s hold on the heart of the Land of Israel,” Bezalel Smotrich, Israel’s far-right finance minister, told a news conference when he announced his approval of the plans.

“Now they declare it clearly and they don’t need to hide it,” said Shawan Jabarin, the general director of Al-Haq, a Palestinian human rights organization based in the West Bank. “It doesn’t need philosophers and intellectuals to analyze. They speak about it themselves: ‘This is to kill any possibility of a Palestinian state.’”

Since the plan was tabled in the early 1990s, Israeli authorities and Jewish settlers like Smotrich have expounded upon the practical needs for new development as Jerusalem has become too crowded and environmental regulations have forbidden new building in the west of the city, which mostly belongs to Israel.

But Palestinians say the area, which straddles the enormous Maale Adumim Jewish settlement and the Palestinian-majority east Jerusalem, is the only undeveloped land that might host government buildings for a new state.

The construction would also split the West Bank in two, again fracturing an incipient Palestinian state already divided between the West Bank and the Gaza Strip, where almost 63,000 people have been killed since Oct. 7, 2023, according to the enclave’s health ministry. Israel launched its military campaign after the Hamas-led terror attacks that day, which killed 1,200 people and saw around 250 taken hostage.

After almost 23 months of war, the country has faced mounting criticism about its conduct from traditional Western allies like the U.K., France and Canada, which have recently made conditional offers to recognize a Palestinian state, unless Israel revives talks to achieve that and agrees to a ceasefire in Gaza.

Those countries were among 21 that criticized the E1 development plans as a “violation of international law” in a statement Friday. “We condemn this decision and call for its immediate reversal in the strongest terms,” it read. British Foreign Minister David Lammy also called Tzipi Hotovely, Israel’s ambassador to the U.K., to raise his objections.

But the recognition of a Palestinian state is seen by some Israeli politicians as rewarding Hamas, leading them to view the E1 proposals as a deliberate broadside against longtime allies whose statements are increasingly drifting away from their country.

“In the eyes of the right wing of Israeli politics, this is diplomatic pushback,” said David Weinberg, a fellow at the Misgav Institute for National Security and Zionist Strategy. “But it’s diplomatic pushback that’s already on top of what have long been salient reasons, good reasons, for Israel wanting to build on E1.”
But for the Israeli right, the resounding triumph of President Donald Trump’s return to the White House has drowned out such protests.

“The E1 plan was initiated three decades ago and it was always blocked due to American pressure,” said Lior Amihai, the executive director of Peace Now, an Israeli advocacy organization. “Now under Trump, they’re approving it. So certainly the lack of American resistance … enabled the Israeli government to approve it.”
The White House did not return a request for comment from NBC News about the E1 development.
Upon retaking office, Trump lifted Biden-era sanctions on Israeli settlers who had been implicated in repeated violence against Palestinians in the West Bank.

In his first term, he moved the U.S. Embassy to Jerusalem and recognized all of the city as Israel’s capital. Most countries consider east Jerusalem to be occupied territory and do not recognize Israeli sovereignty. Israel, which captured east Jerusalem, including the Old City, from Jordan in the 1967 Middle East war, deems it as its eternal, indivisible capital.

So far this year, Israel has approved 25,000 settlement housing units in the West Bank, Amihai said, far surpassing the record of 12,000 units during the whole of 2020 — a massive increase Amihai credited in part to Trump because his administration had created “an environment where it’s easier for this government,” because “they don’t have to hide anything, they can say it vocally out loud.”

The additional units will accommodate the burgeoning growth of the 700,000 settlers the United Nations estimates already live in the West Bank in settlements widely considered illegal under international law.

Even as the E1 plan slogged through decades of bureaucratic and diplomatic obstacles, Israeli officials prepared the land some of their countrymen refer to as Judea and Samaria, using the biblical term, with a clear intention to develop it.

The Samaria and Judea Police District headquarters relocated there in 2008. Highways and other roadworks connecting Jerusalem and Maale Adumim’s infrastructure to the same largely uninhabited land have also been installed.

Once housing there is finished, Palestinian observers say the area will become closed to their community. Even those simply driving through from the Palestinian provisional capital of Ramallah to the southern West Bank town of Bethlehem will probably have to seek longer routes, they say.
Such detours shouldn’t preclude further agreements between Palestinians and Israelis, Weinberg said, even as he dismissed the notion of a Palestinian state under current circumstances.

“Instead of battering Israel, the West should be advancing realistic space-saving arrangements for Judea and Sumeria,” he said. “Israel’s need to build on E1 does not need to be a bar to an agreement with a serious Palestinian government.”

Yet the Israeli right wing has made its intentions known, Jabarin said. Such a sudden, strenuous assault on Palestinian statehood — particularly with American blessings — will require more than diplomatic rhetoric to reverse.
“Wording there, condemnations here — it doesn’t make any change,” he said. “It will not push Israel back in any way.”

title: Time capsule sealed by Princess Diana is revealed decades later
summary: A time capsule placed inside a wall at a London children's hospital by Diana, Princess of Wales been opened for the first time in almost 35 years, revealing a treasure trove of 1990s memorabilia.
story: LONDON — Diana, Princess of Wales, is for many a symbol of life in the 1990s. And now a time capsule she buried nearly 35 years ago has been opened, revealing a treasure trove of memorabilia.
The capsule was placed inside a wall at the Great Ormond Street Hospital in London in 1991 with the help of two children who won a TV competition.
It contained relics of a pre-internet-enabled age, including an early pocket TV, a Kylie Minogue CD, a solar-powered calculator and a copy of The Times newspaper.

The items were decided via a competition run by the long-running British children’s TV show “Blue Peter” — viewers were asked to decide eight things that represented life in the 1990s. Despite some moisture damage, the items were still recognizable.

The box was not due to be opened until centuries had passed, but the timeline had to be drastically cut short because the hospital is demolishing existing buildings to build a new children’s cancer center.
The CD was the choice of David Watson, then age 11, from Devon in western England, as well as a sheet of recycled paper and a European passport.
A collection of British coins, a container with five tree seeds and a snowflake hologram were the choices of Sylvia Foulkes, then age 9, from Norwich in eastern England.
It's unclear what the children, who would both now be in their 40s, thought of the opening. The hospital told NBC News that it was no longer in touch with them.
The hospital asked staff members either born in 1991 or already working there in 1991 to help remove the capsule.
